short_description: This is a special experiment that does not show any stimulus for the duration of the experiment.
long_description:
This experiment is universal, in that it is not dependent on what sensory modality/model is used in the
given simulation. It will ensure that no sensory stimulation will be performed.  

Notes
-----
Unlike :class:`.MeasureSpontaneousActivity` this can be used in model with no sensory input sheet.

duration: The duration of single presentation of the stimulus.

short_description: Measure orientation tuning using a fullfield sinusoidal grating.
long_description:
This experiment will show a series of full-field sinusoidal gratings 
that vary in orientation, while the other parameters remain constant.

grating_duration: The duration of single presentation of a grating.
contrasts: List of contrasts (expressed as % : 0-100%) at which to measure the orientation tuning.
num_trials: int
Number of trials each each stimulus is shown.
shuffle_stimuli: If True, stumuli are shuffled randomly

short_description: Optogenetic stimulation with an arbitrary pattern
long_description:
Optogenetic stimulation of cortical sheets with an array of light sources, in the pattern of a grayscale image, stored as a .npy file containing a 2D
numpy array, with values between 0 (black) and 1 (white). If the image has a
different aspect ratio or number of pixels as the stimulation array, it will
be stretched to fit the array.

The experiment accepts either the path to a single image, or a directory
containing images. All .npy files in such a supplied directory have to
be 2D and have values in the range of (0,1).

The mapping between the axes of the numpy array and cortical space
is 0->X, 1->Y.

Does not show any actual visual stimulus.

sheet_list: The list of sheets in which to do stimulation.
sheet_intensity_scaler: Scale the stimulation intensity of each sheet in sheet_list by the constants in this list. Must have equal length to sheet_list. The constants must be in the range (0,infinity).
sheet_transfection_proportion: Set the proportion of transfected cells in each sheet in sheet_list. Must have equal length to sheet_list. The constants must be in the range (0,1) - 0 means no cells, 1 means all cells.
num_trials: int
Number of trials each stimulus is shown.
stimulator_array_parameters: Parameters for the optical stimulator array.
intensities: Intensities of the stimulation. Uniform across the circle.
duration: The duration of single presentation of the stimulus.
onset_time: Time point when the stimulation turns on
offset_time: Time point when the stimulation turns off
images_path: Path to either the .npy image array to read for stimulation, or the directory containing the .npy image arrays to read for stimulation.

short_description: Optogenetic stimulation of cortical sheets with an array of light sources.
long_description:
Creates a array of optical stimulators covering an area of cortex, and then
stimulates the array based on the stimulating_signal function in the
stimulator_array_parameters, *num_trials* times.

Does not show any actual visual stimulus.

sheet_list: The list of sheets in which to do stimulation.
sheet_intensity_scaler: Scale the stimulation intensity of each sheet in sheet_list by the constants in this list. Must have equal length to sheet_list. The constants must be in the range (0,infinity).
sheet_transfection_proportion: Set the proportion of transfected cells in each sheet in sheet_list.
num_trials: int
Number of trials each stimulus is shown.
stimulator_array_parameters: Parameters for the optical stimulator array.
stimulating_signal: Described in more detail in  mozaik.sheets.direct_stimulator.OpticalStimulatorArrayChR. Path to the function that specifies the timecourse of the optogenetic array stimulation.

short_description: Measure frequency sensitivity using sinusoidal grating disk.
long_description:
This experiment shows a series of full-field drifting sinusoidal gratings 
of varying spatial and temporal frequencies. Using the responses to these 
stimuli one can construct the spatial and/or temporal frequency tuning 
curve for the measured neurons.

orientation: The orientation (in radians) at which to measure the size tuning. (in future this will become automated)
spatial_frequencies: List of spatial frequencies of the gratings.
grating_duration: The duration of single presentation of a grating.
contrasts: List of contrasts (expressed as % : 0-100%) at which measure the tuning.
num_trials: int
Number of trials each each stimulus is shown.
square: Whether the stimulus shoul be sinusoidal or square grating
shuffle_stimuli: If True, stumuli are shuffled randomly

short_description: Measure frequency sensitivity using sinusoidal grating disk with simultaneous optogenetic stimulation
long_description:
This experiment shows a series of full-field drifting square gratings 
of a specific spatial and temporal frequency, while simultaneously optogenetically
stimulating the center of the cortex in a circular area.

duration: The duration of single presentation of the stimulus.
shuffle_stimuli: If True, stumuli are shuffled randomly
